  • Constructor Details

    • Vector

      public Vector(double x, double y, double z)
      Creates a 3-dimensional Vector which has base at the origin and head at the coordinates (x, y, x)
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the created Vector
      y - the y-coordinate of the created Vector
      z - the z-coordinate of the created Vector

    • Vector

      public Vector(Point p)
      Creates a 3-dimensional Vector which has base at the origin (0, 0, 0) and head at the coordinates of the Point p.
      Parameters:
      p - a 3-dimensional Cartesian coordinate

    • Vector

      public Vector(Point from, Point to)
      Create a new vector from point1 to point2.
      Parameters:
      from - the point which will serve as the base of the created Vector
      to - the point which will serve as the head of the created Vector

  • Method Details

    • normalize

      public Vector normalize()
      The magnitude of a Vector is equivalent to the length of a line drawn from the base of that Vector to its tip. By dividing each of a Vector's coordinates by its magnitude, this method returns a vector which points in the same direction as the original vector, but the new vector's magnitude is normalised to equal 1.
      Returns:
      the current vector normalised to length 1

    • magnitude

      public double magnitude()
      The magnitude of a Vector is equivalent to the length of a line from the base of that Vector to its tip.
      Returns:
      the magnitude of the current vector

    • plus

      public Vector plus(Vector v)
      Returns a Vector found by adding the corresponding elements of the current Vector and the Vector v. This can be thought of as the vector found by placing the base of the current Vector at the origin, placing the base of Vector v at the head of the current Vector, and then the coordinates at head of the Vector v are the coordinates of the new Vector.
      Parameters:
      v - a Vector to be added to current Vector
      Returns:
      the Vector found by adding current Vector and v

    • minus

      public Vector minus(Vector v)
      Returns a Vector found by subtracting the corresponding elements of v from the current Vector. This resulting Vector can be thought of as the Vector found by placing both the current Vector and v with their bases at the origin and the Vector with base at the head of v and head at the head of the current Vector.
      Parameters:
      v - a Vector to be subtracted from the current Vector
      Returns:
      the Vector found by subtracting v from the current Vector

    • negate

      public Vector negate()
      Flips the direction of the current Vector.
      Returns:
      Vector pointing in opposite direction to current Vector having the same magnitude

    • times

      public Vector times(double scalar)
      A Vector v times a scalar c results in a new Vector pointing in the same direction as the original Vector but has magnitude equal to c multiplied by the magnitude of v. It essentially scales up or down the current Vector. Scaling by a negative scalar flips direction but is otherwise the same.
      Parameters:
      scalar - a real number
      Returns:
      scaled up/down version of the current Vector

    • cross

      public Vector cross(Vector v)
      Computes the vector cross product between the current Vector and v. The resulting Vector is perpendicular to the plane traced out between the current Vector and v.
      Parameters:
      v - the Vector to be crossed with the current Vector
      Returns:
      perpendicular Vector to plane traced out by v and current Vector

    • dot

      public double dot(Vector v)
      Returns the dot product of the current Vector with v. Dot product is equal to the sum of the product of the two vectors respective elements.
      Parameters:
      v - the Vector to be dotted with the current Vector
      Returns:
      the dot product of the current Vector with v

    • halfway

      public static Vector halfway(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      Computes the halfway vector between the incident and reflected Ray used in the Blinn-Phong reflection model.
      Parameters:
      v1 - normalised incident Ray to a surface
      v2 - normalised reflected Ray from a surface
      Returns:
      the normalised halfway Vector between these two lines

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string of the coordinates/elements of the current Vector
